description: Add location support to events: an address field and optional Google Maps link so guests can easily find the venue.

userStories.title: Add location fields to event creation form
userStories.description: As an event host, I want to enter a venue address and optional Google Maps link when creating an event so that my guests know where to go.
acceptanceCriteria: The event creation form at src/app/create/ includes a 'Location / Address' text input field
The form includes an optional 'Google Maps Link' URL input field below the address
Both fields are optional — events can still be created without a location
The Google Maps link field validates that the URL starts with https:// when provided
Submitting the form persists location and maps_link to the events table in Supabase
The events table has 'location' (text, nullable) and 'maps_link' (text, nullable) columns
TypeScript typecheck passes with no errors (npm run build)
E2E test in e2e/event-creation.spec.ts verifies the location and maps link fields render and submit correctly

userStories.title: Display location on public event page
userStories.description: As an event guest, I want to see the event's address and a clickable Google Maps link on the public event page so that I can easily navigate to the venue.
acceptanceCriteria: The public event page at src/app/e/[slug]/ displays the location address when present
When a maps_link is provided, the address is wrapped in a clickable link that opens Google Maps in a new tab (target='_blank', rel='noopener noreferrer')
When no maps_link is provided but location is set, the address text is displayed with an auto-generated Google Maps search link (https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=<encoded address>)
When no location is set, the location section is not rendered at all
A map pin icon (from an inline SVG or existing icon set) is shown next to the address
The location display is mobile-responsive following the existing Tailwind mobile-first pattern
TypeScript typecheck passes with no errors (npm run build)
E2E test in e2e/public-event.spec.ts verifies location and maps link render correctly for seeded events

userStories.title: Include location in RSVP and guest-facing views
userStories.description: As a guest viewing my RSVP page, I want to see the event location so that I have all the details I need in one place.
acceptanceCriteria: The RSVP page at src/app/rsvp/[token]/ displays the event location and maps link using the same presentation as the public event page
The location section appears above the RSVP form so guests see it before responding
Extract the location display into a shared component at src/components/EventLocation.tsx to avoid duplication between the public page and RSVP page
The shared component accepts location (string | null) and mapsLink (string | null) props
TypeScript typecheck passes with no errors (npm run build)
E2E test in e2e/rsvp.spec.ts verifies location appears on the RSVP page for a seeded event with location data
